pericarp is loosely attached and often readily removed (utricle)

Is the fruit surface wrinkled (reticulate), or covered with bumps (tuberculate)

Does fruit NOT split open at maturity (indehiscent)
Does the fruit splits along seams to release seeds (capsule)

Is the fruit elongated but height/width less than  3 (silicle)
Does the fruit split around the middle and the top falls off exposing the (pyxis)
Does the fruit split into two valves, but has a single carpel like a pea pod (legume)
Is the fruit fleshy, with  firm inner ovary wall that encloses a single seed (drupe)
Is the fruit dry and indehiscent, with a hard wall, usually containing only one seed (nut)
Is the fruit composed of multiple fused ovaries from one flower (aggregate)

Do petal gradually or does not narrow
abruptly
spoon-shaped (narrow near the base, then suddenly widening to a rounded tip (spatulate))
rectangular but with rounded ends (oblong)
lance-shaped with the widest point above the middle of the leaf blade (oblanceolate)

roughly circular, as wide as long (orbicular)

roughly triangular

rounded
Does sepal tip tapers to a very narrow point (acuminate)
lobed or fringed

rectangular, but with rounded ends (oblong)

Are stamens all approximately the same length
Are there four long stamens and two short ones (tetradynamous)
Are there two long stamens and two short ones (didynamous)
like half a sphere (hemispherical)
Are fruits with parallel sides that do not taper, and flat across the top and bottom (cylindrical)
spherical

Is fruit egg-shaped (ovoid)
Is fruit egg-shaped, but with the widest point above the middle (obovoid)

Is fruit narrow, widest below the middle and tapering at both ends (lanceoloid)

Is fruit roughly pear-shaped (pyriform)
conical
Is the base of the fruit notched or cordate
Is the base of fruit truncate to rounded
Is fruit narrrow, widest above the middle and tapering at both ends (oblanceoloid)
point upward or spread or curve outward
curve or droop downwards
young fruits extending well above flowers and buds
young fruits generally not extending above flowers and buds

Are the edges of leaf blade curled under
Are the the edges of leaf blade are curled up
Does the major veins radiate out from one point at the base
Does the secondary veins branch off at intervals from the primary vein
leafy (herbaceous)
thin and dry like paper (scarious)
thin and flexible and almost translucent like a membrane (membranaceous)
spongy
firm, leathery (coriaceous)

Does the major veins form a net-like pattern due to splitting and rejoining

Do three or more main veins that start at or near the leaf blade base and run from the base towards the tip

Is leaf hair curved or lying flat, mostly pointed toward the  base of the leaf
dull or slightly shiny
very shiny
gradualy
abruptly

Are the lower leaves on the stem, toothier, and/or on longer stalks than the upper leaves
unpleasant
pleasant

Do stem hairs point downwards
Do plant hairs bend outwards and then downwards

Does the stem trail at the base, but may turn upwards at the tips
Is it a solitary plant
Are there a few plants growing together

Are stems densely matted together in clumps, cushionlike
very thin but flexible, like a membrane
leaf-like
firm or rigid
thin and dry, paperlike
Is the anther attached near its midpoint to the filament
Is the anther attached by its base to the filament
Do one or more sepals have a horn-like (hardened) appendage
Do one or more sepals have a spine at the tip

Do one or more sepals have a prominent keel (a ridge that runs along the midline from base to tip)

notched

Is each ray of the umbel terminating in another smaller umbel (branched umbel)
Does the inflorescence has only one flower on it

simple umbels
simple
Is the inflorescence forked spike with 2 or more verticils
contracted
elongate
